citRespParty.rpOrgName: Gunther, G. L., Graeber, A. E., Drake, R.M. II

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Cell maps are created by the USGS as a method for illustrating the degree of petroleum exploration, type of production as indicated by final well status, distribution of production and well density in a given area; in this case, covering the SaMiRa project area of interest. Each cell represents a quarter-mile square of the land surface, and the cells are coded to represent whether oil and gas wells included within the cell are predominantly oil-producing, gas-producing, both oil and gas-producing, dry or the type of production of the wells located within the cell is unknown. The well information was initially retrieved from the IHS Energy Enerdeq, which is a proprietary, commercial database containing information for most oil and gas wells in the United States. Cells were developed as a graphic solution to overcome the problem of displaying proprietary well data. No proprietary data are displayed or included in this dataset. The data from IHS were current as of February 2016. This particular cell dataset was created for the Sagebrush Mineral Resource Assessment project (SaMiRa). Please see the purpose section for further information on SaMiRa.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) is providing the U.S. Bureau of Land Management (BLM) a mineral resource assessment for locatable minerals and an inventory of leasable and salable minerals for seven Sagebrush Focal Areas (SFAs) covering approximately 10 million acres of Sage Grouse habitat distributed across six western states: Oregon, Nevada, Idaho, Utah, Wyoming, and Montana. The USGS will integrate the best available geological, geophysical, and geochemical data with mineral deposit information to provide a qualitative mineral resource assessment of selected locatable minerals in the SFAs and a review of the most important leasable minerals, including energy resources, known to be present in the SFAs to help inform the land use planning decision for long-term withdrawal of the SFA lands from mineral entry. This effort is referred to as SaMiRa within this document. Scientists traditionally supported by the USGS Energy Program will provide a review of the location and mineral claim and lease information for leasable minerals (i.e., oil, gas, coal, geothermal energy minerals, and phosphate deposits) that have a history of production within the individual SFAs. This dataset is intended to support this effort. The purpose of the cell map is to display the exploration maturity, type of production as determined by well status, distribution of production, and finally well density in quarter-mile cells within the SaMiRa study area.

report.measDesc: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.

Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details. Dataset was derived using IHS Well Data as of February 2016.

No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted. However, this dataset was derived from IHS Well data and attribute information reliant on this information is as only as accurate as the original well data.
A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.
A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

prcStep.stepDesc: The dataset was developed in ARCGIS using a Python Script. This script applies to wells located within the contiguous United States. The script projects IHS well data (downloaded February 2016) to "USA Contiguous Albers Equal Area Conic USGS." A fishnet, consisting of quarter mile squared polygons, is then created using the extent of the wells data. Each polygon gets selected based on the classification of the wells located within the polygon. Wells from IHS with Final_Status_Code of 1 or 4 are oil wells. Wells from IHS with Final_Status_Code of 2, 3, 5 or 6 are gas wells. Wells from IHS with Final_Status_Code of 7 are oil and gas producing wells. Wells from IHS with Final_Status_Code of 0, 8, 9, A, L, S, T, D, I, W, F or NULL are considered dry/abandoned or other wells. The Type_of_Wells field for each polygon in the fishnet is then updated based on the type wells located within each polygon. For the Type_of_Wells field polygons are classified as follows: polygons containing only and at least 1 oil well are classified as type 1 (these may also contain abandoned or other wells). Polygons containing only and at least 1 Gas Well are classified as type 2 (these may also contain abandoned or other wells). Polygons containing oil and gas wells are classified as type 3 (these may also contain abandoned or other wells), or polygons containing ONLY dry/abandoned or other wells were classified as type 4. Polygons without wells are removed from the final fishnet.

Field well data was downloaded from IHS and was copied to a new feature class modification. A new text field was added and Using the field calculator with VB script, the field was calculated using the following expression: [Longitude]&”_”&[Latitude]. This combined the values in the longitude and latitude fields for each record using an underscore to separate the values. The "delete identical" tool was then used to find and delete identical records. This was required because there are often many records for the same well due to a variety of scenarios including new completions, deeper drilling or well ownership transfer to name a few. This table was then joined spatially to the square quarter mile cells feature class. The number of well records within each cell was then added to a new field in the new feature class resulting from the spatial join. A new integer field called was then added and joined with the production data field based on OBJECTID.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.
